title: What is re-registration in IGNOU? - Quora

response.answer_text: Re-registration in IGNOU has two meanings. Meaning 1: When you are taking admission for 2nd year or 3rd year, it is known as re-registration process. You have to pay for the course fees and you get re-registered. The fees here is the programme course fees which is divided in the equal number of terms. For e.g. if you took admission for BDP course, then the total fees is ₹ 6000 which is divided into 3 parts, i.e. ₹ 2000 for each term. You have to pay ₹ 2000 as re-registration fees. Meaning 2: There is a maximum time period for every programme course. If you are unable to complete your programme course in the said time period then your registration for that programme course gets over. If you want to complete your course after the said time period, then you have to register for that programme course again by paying reregistration fees. I hope this satisfies your query.
